text: the ancient Maya were so dedicated to

and stars that they even constructed
this building an extraordinary
observatory well this is in Caracol it's
a wonderful building and it received

means snail or seashell in Spanish
because hidden inside the observatory is
a spiral staircase this one in
particular serve the purpose of guessing
the the skies in mapping them under were
very good astronomers they have a very
good knowledge of the movement of the

building it's on top of several

Sin City
due to the caracoles ruined condition
few of the Observatory windows remain
there is actually three of them they are
very interesting aligned the Maya
aligned the cutter coal with the heavens
the main staircase faces the setting
point of Venus one of the most important
objects in the Maya sky the tower on the
top has windows that line up with
Venus's northern and southern most
positions and a third window is aligned
with astronomical South the corners of
the base platform aligned with the sun's
shadow on the Solstice sunrise and
sunset
incredibly at least 20 astronomical
events are incorporated into this
structure the Maya used their
observations to predict harvests deaths
and even good times to go to war
